comments.body: Is there a case where the guard is not set?

I don't see what you mean. It's not a guard, but a switch. However, the switch (old name) was switching both memory pools for RooArgSet or RooDataSet, or only one - depending on the order of inclusion.
Therefore, I changed the names of both switches such that each only switches on/off for one of the two sets.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +22,26 @@

#define USEMEMPOOLFORARGSET
template <class RooSet_t, size_t>
class MemPoolForRooSets;
